channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The audible sound for this crossing isnâ€™t working, 17th November
item.description:
My mum is registered partially sighted and requires the sound so she is confident when to cross. The crossing is on Lansdown road at the junction with Christchurch Road opposite Thorncliffe Flats
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Iron works from overflowing drain some weeks ago just appears abandoned, 17th November
item.description:
Iron works from overflowing drain some weeks ago just appears abandoned. There is highways fencing around the drain on the footpath - just no longer appears relevant.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: PROW is blocked by locked gate and heavily overgrown with shrubbery, 17th November
item.description:
PROW is blocked by locked gate and heavily overgrown with shrubbery. Concern here is that if the PROW is not used over significant time then the PROW privilege may be lost.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malleson Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop bay all overgrown and littered, 17th November
item.description:
Bus stop bay all overgrown and littered. Grass and weeds cover more of the area than tarmac over a circa 20 - 25 meter stretch and as such is holder no end of litter. This area needs a good clean up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kerb stone raised several inches and wobbling, 17th November
item.description:
It is between Gallops lane 22 and 24. It's a danger to little children's fingers and old people who can trip over it - it's VERY heavy. It could also cause damage to cars. I couldn't fix it myself so I think your team should come and fix it please. I think a big delivery lorry dislodged it! Thanks, Rich. It's been like this for about a month.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Gallops Lane, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flyposting, 17th November
item.description:
There is almost continuouse flyposting on the telegraph pole on the left side of Leckhampton Road going north. Just before the junction with Church Road. Trees are also used in this area all along Leckhampton Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 201, Old Bath Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes/poorly patched bits of road which are dangerous enough to cause a cyclist to come off bike. Also, if try and get round them have to pull right into the middle of road with danger as a result from cars from behind. Potholes can't be seen at all in the dark!, 17th November
item.description:
I don't know the number but the potholes cover a very large area about half way down charlton Lane/Greenhills Road (going west) going towards miniroundabout at railway bridge. Have been there for over a year!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Greenhills Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sink hole in road, 17th November
item.description:
On the road going north outside approximately No 255 Old Bath Road (house with [portable loo] outside). Sink hole is bad for cars but lethal for cyclists who can't see it even in the light, let alone the dark.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 263a, Old Bath Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised ironwork and sunken tarmac around it in middle of lane going South. Very dangerous as very narrow road at blind junction and cars swing out to avoid it, crossing the white line. Very dangerous junction anyway. Not just bad for cars but lethal for cyclists!, 17th November
item.description:
Just after the railway bridge/after the pedestrian crossing, opposite Charlton Lane exit. Has been present for months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 200, Old Bath Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
